title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD stays volatile within range, setting off the Fed week
summary: Gold is moving back and forth in a familiar range around the $3,650 barrier, kicking off a big central bank week early Monday.

title: Gold Weekly Forecast: Fed policy decisions to trigger next big action in XAU/USD
summary: Gold (XAU/USD) touched a new record-high above $3,670 before entering a consolidation phase. The Federal Reserve’s (Fed) policy decisions could allow investors to decide whether XAU/USD has more room on the upside, despite technically overbought conditions.

title: EUR/USD Weekly Forecast: Ladies and gentlemen, here comes the Fed
summary: The EUR/USD pair survived yet another uneventful week, hovering in the vicinity of the 1.1700 level. The pair seesawed between gains and losses, confined to familiar levels amid speculation about the upcoming Federal Reserve (Fed) monetary policy decision, scheduled to be announced on Wednesday.

title: Forecasting the Upcoming Week: Fed in full view, it’s Powell’s time to shine
summary: The US Dollar (USD) ended another week with small declines. The Greenback has been caught in a mild consolidation phase for the better part of five weeks, stuck in a volatile rut near 98.00.

title: GBP/USD Forecast: Pound Sterling stabilizes ahead of US data
summary: GBP/USD stays under modest bearish pressure and trades at around 1.3550 after gaining about 0.3% on Thursday.

title: EUR/USD Forecast: Euro loses bullish momentum on mixed ECB commentary
summary: EUR/USD struggles to hold its ground and declines toward 1.1700 on Friday after posting modest gains on Thursday. The pair's near-term technical outlook points to a loss of bullish momentum as markets assess comments from European Central Bank (ECB) policymakers.

title: AUD/USD Price Forecast: Could appreciate further amid dovish Fed-inspired USD weakness
summary: The AUD/USD pair edges lower during the early part of the European session and for now, seems to have snapped a two-day winning streak to the highest level since November 2024 touched this Friday.

title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD attempts another run toward record highs, will it succeed?
summary: Gold is reversing the previous decline to retest the $3,650 barrier early Friday.

title: EUR/USD Price Forecast: United States inflation data hints at three rate cuts in 2025
summary: The EUR/USD pair trades near an intraday high of 1.1746, after falling to a low of 1.1660 during European trading hours. The pair saw little action throughout the first half of Thursday, as market participants were waiting for first-tier events.

title: AUD/USD Forecast: Australian Dollar reaches fresh 2025 highs after US inflation data
summary: The Australian Dollar (AUD) was among the best performers against the US Dollar (USD) on Thursday, with the AUD/USD pair reaching the 0.6660 region for the first time since November 2024.

title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD holds ground as investors await fresh clues
summary: Gold price held within familiar levels on Thursday, hovering around $3,630 in the mid-American session. The XAU/USD pair suffered a minor intraday setback ahead of first-tier events, which were unable to spur action around the bright metal.

title: EUR/USD Price Forecast: Loads of noise, little action after ECB, US CPI
summary: The EUR/USD pair traded with a soft tone throughout the first half of the day, holding below the 1.1700 mark ahead of critical first-tier events. The first one was the European Central Bank (ECB) monetary policy decision. As widely anticipated, the central bank left interest rates unchanged.

title: GBP/USD Forecast: Pound Sterling closes in on key support area ahead of US CPI
summary: After closing the day virtually unchanged on Wednesday, GBP/USD stays on the back foot early Thursday and trades in negative territory at around 1.3500. The pair faces a critical support level at 1.3470 as investors refrain from taking large positions ahead of August inflation data from the US.

title: USD/JPY Price Forecast: 200-day SMA holds the key for bulls; focus remains on US CPI
summary: The USD/JPY pair attracts some buying during the early European session on Thursday and builds on this week's rebound from the 146.30 area, or the vicinity of the August monthly swing low.
